formatDescription: Windows Setup File or Installer Script.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: Setup Information File 1
internalSignatures.note: ASCII: [Version]..Signature="$CHICAGO$". By convention, the Version section appears first in INF files, although this is not always the case in practice. Every Windows INF file must have this section. This version of the inf file can appear in all Windows operating systems

internalSignatures.name: Setup Information File 2
internalSignatures.note: ASCII: [Version]..Signature="$WINDOWS NT$". By convention, the Version section appears first in INF files, although this is not always the case in practice. Every Windows INF file must have this section. This version of the inf file can appear in all Windows NT based operating systems

internalSignatures.name: Setup Information File 3
internalSignatures.note: ASCII: [Version]..Signature="$Windows 95$". By convention, the Version section appears first in INF files, although this is not always the case in practice. Every Windows INF file must have this section. This version of the inf file can appear in all Windows 9x/ME operating systems

source.name: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
